title.narrative: CDI-pilot digital platform in Quang Tri

description.narrative: The digital platform will help people and businesses use digital information services according to their personalized need throughout their entire life, on-demand in an easy, convenient, and simple manner as well as being fast, paperless, and with no need for physical appearance unless required by law. The platform allows the people and businesses to participate and give feedbacks to state departments on social issues and receive responses regarding their participation and the result of their participation. To carry out this initiative, the platform would have the following main functions: - Information request from people and businesses are transferred by an automatic system to an information focal point of the departments - Monitoring the handling and responding process of the departments responsible for providing information - Providing tools to help people and businesses assess the quality and level of feedback mechanism (timely, complete, accurate, the quality of information provided) - People can see the aggregated results of requests for information. - The digital platform creates a favorable working conditions and tools for public officers and civil servants tocarry out their duties, cooperate and work together to simplify the decision-making process, roll out timely decisions, issue better policies, maximizes the use of resources. For public officers and civil servants who act as the focal point to provide informationfor the state departments: • Be notified automatically when a request for new information is submitted and when the deadline for response is approaching • Respond to request of information from people and businesses • Analyze the request statistics, process the results • Analyze the statistics on evaluation results/feedback from those who request for information - The digital platform helps directors of departments, People’s Committee, and the Fatherland’s Front to improve state management efficiency, carrying out their role as monitors as assigned, in particular: • Assess the demand for information from people and businesses to have a plan to disseminate information widely to the people and community. • View the statistics of request for information from each department, process the results of each officer. • View the statistics on evaluation results/responses from those who request for information • Compare the results of their own department to other

participating-org.narrative: Center for Development and Integration (CDI) is Vietnamese non #governmental, non- profit organization working for the rights of the disadvantaged groups to build a society of equity, solidarity and sustainable development. Vision The Center for Development and Integration aims at socio-economic development and good governance to build a society where the poor, women, men and children are respected and treated fairly in the context of rapid economic integration in Vietnam and Asia. Mission To make acontribution to narrowing the social gaps and finding solutions to the emerging issues of the society through supporting activities, advocacy and capacitybuilding. Goal (2015-2020) To be a capable and prestigious civil society organizaton that aims towards equitable and sustainable development and shared prosperity through activities to promote and ensure the rights of disadvantaged groups. Priorities themes Good Governance Labor rights Inclusive Growth Regarding Good Governance theme, CDI bringsmore than 8 years of experience working in participatory planning and budget transparency, accountability and people#s participation (BTAP) in Vietnam. CDI is responsible for carrying out the Open Budget Survey in Vietnam every two years and working on monthly online budget tracker for Vietnam. Joining the international network on budget transparency given CDI the many chances to exchange, shared learning and capacity building on budget transparency and accountability, especially citizen budget tool. CDIis a member of Budget Transparency Coalition of Vietnam CSOs advocating for State budget law amendment towards Transparency, Accountability and People Participation; an active member of CSO#s workinggroup advocating Vietnam Government joining Open Government Partnership. CDI also has significant local experiences across provinces in Vietnam, having carried out social audits, budget monitoring, participatory budget and planning, promoting people participationin development process, capacity building forlocal partners and developed working relationships with local institutions and actors. CDI has been collaborating with Irish Aid, EC, Oxfam, AFAP, CBPP (Center on Budget and Policy Priorities), etc for the work on BTAPin Vietnam.
